content.question: Two students want to determine the speed at which a ball is released when thrown vertically upward into the air. One student throws the ball into the air while the other student measures the total time that the ball is in the air. The students use a meterstick to measure the release height of the ball. Which of the following equations should the students use to determine the speed at which the ball was released?

choices.label: Use <math alttext="y equals, y sub 0, end sub, plus v sub y 0, end sub, times t, plus one half times a, sub y, end sub, times t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> from the moment in time in which the ball was released to the moment in time in which the ball reaches its highest point.

Use <math alttext="y equals, y sub 0, end sub, plus v sub y 0, end sub, times t, plus one half times a, sub y, end sub, times t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> from the moment in time in which the ball was released to the moment in time in which the ball hits the ground.

<math alttext="v sub y, end sub, squared, equals, v sub y 0, end sub, squared, plus 2 times a sub y, end sub, times, open parenthesis, y minus y sub 0, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> from the moment in time in which the ball was released to the moment in time in which the ball reaches its highest point.

<math alttext="v sub y, end sub, squared, equals, v sub y 0, end sub, squared, plus 2 times a sub y, end sub, times, open parenthesis, y minus y sub 0, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> from the moment in time in which the ball was released to the moment in time in which the ball hits the ground.

content.answer: Use <math alttext="y equals, y sub 0, end sub, plus v sub y 0, end sub, times t, plus one half times a, sub y, end sub, times t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> from the moment in time in which the ball was released to the moment in time in which the ball hits the ground.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
